channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Pete Buttigieg slams JD Vance's 'childless cat lady' jibe: 'You shouldn't be...'
item.description: Buttigieg is the first openly gay Cabinet member married to Chasten Buttigieg, a teacher, author and an activist. They have two adopted children. “The really sad thing is, he said that after Chasten [Buttigieg] and I had been through a fairly heartbreaking setback in our adoption journey,” he said on the CNN.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'More Ukrainians willing to cede territory to Russia for peace'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China squeezes Taiwan by targeting islands and fishing sites
item.description: Taiwanese fishermen report a significant change in their traditional fishing practices near Chinese waters due to increased patrols by the Chinese Coast Guard. This shift follows the detention of a Taiwanese fishing boat and its crew by Beijing for the first time in 17 years for violating a fishing ban. This situation indicates China's new tactics to exert pressure on Taiwan

item.title: Watch: Escalator fire at New York's JFK Airport prompts temporary evacuation
item.description: On Wednesday morning, a fire broke out on an escalator at John F. Kennedy International Airport's Terminal 8 in New York, resulting in a brief evacuation of the area. Fire department officials in New York stated that the fire was reported at approximately 7 am. Fortunately, no one was injured during the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Doug Emhoff is gonna make Melania Trump look like...': Video of Kamala Harris' husband viral
item.description: A video of Kamala Harris' husband Douglas Emhoff is doing the rounds where he is fervently speaking about his wife, the vice president and former president Donald Trump's attack on her. The video is drawing comparisons between the spouses of the probable presidential candidates -- considering Kamala Harris will be the Democratic candidate against Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I was called a witch': Hillary Clinton's advice for 'chronically underestimated' Kamala Harris
item.description: Hillary Clinton extended support to vice president Kamala Harris as the Democratic presidential candidate and said she will have an uphill battle as the first Black and South Asian woman to be at the top of a major party’s ticket. In an opinion piece on New York Times, Hillary Clinton commended President Joe Biden's decision and said Kamala Harris can defeat Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Most beautiful biker' Tatyana Ozolina dies in motorbike accident
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In fuel-guzzling Saudi Arabia, electric cars pique interest
item.description: For Hamed al-Rafidain, a Saudi human resources worker, an electric vehicle offers welcome savings, especially since his other car is a fuel-guzzling four-wheeler favoured by motorists in the desert kingdom. "What drove me to buy an electric vehicle was financial considerations," said Rafidain, who spends up to 2,000 riyals ($530) a month on fuel for his off-road vehicle.

item.title: 'Jimmy Carter passed away' turns out to be social 'experiment': Fake news alert
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: 'A choice between freedom and chaos': US presidential candidate Kamala Harris rallies voters in Milwaukee
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris launched her campaign rally in Milwaukee, attacking former President Trump and framing the election as a choice between 'freedom and chaos.' Bolstered by $100 million in donations and endorsements from key Democrats, Harris emphasised her prosecutorial background and commitment to a 'people first' campaign. Trump's campaign quickly labelled her 'Lyin' Kamala Harris, while Republican leaders dismissed her as an 'extreme liberal.'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Like finding an oasis in desert ...': Nasa's Curiosity rover stuns scientists with discovery of pure sulphur on Mars
item.description: Nasa's Curiosity rover has made a groundbreaking find on Mars, discovering pure sulphur in rocks after driving over and cracking them open. This unexpected discovery, made on May 30 in the Gediz Vallis channel, intrigues scientists and prompts a reevaluation of Mars' geological history and potential for life. The find marks a rare event in planetary exploration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: High-profile divorce in Dubai's royal family: Who is Sheikha Mahra's ex-husband Sheikh Mana?
item.description: Sheikha Mahra Bint Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, daughter of Dubai’s ruler, announced her divorce from Sheikh Mana Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Bin Mana Al Maktoum via Instagram on July 16, accusing him of infidelity and invoking 'triple talaq'. The couple had welcomed their first child earlier this year. Sheikh Mana, a 25-year-old entrepreneur, is known for his royal connections and adventurous lifestyle.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris may urge Israeli PM Netanyahu to end war in Gaza during his White House visit
item.description: Kamala Harris planned to ask Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu to end the Israel-Hamas conflict during his visit to the White House, highlighting security for Israel and dignity for Palestinians. Her absence from Netanyahu's Congress address drew criticism due to her prior commitments.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Typhoon Gaemi floods Manila with knee-deep water, 16 flights cancelled
item.description: Typhoon Gaemi and the southwest monsoon have caused severe flooding across Manila and Luzon Island, with knee-deep water in several areas. The storm has led to 16 flight cancellations, the suspension of government offices and classes, and widespread road closures. A 14-year-old boy is missing, and Gaemi is expected to continue bringing heavy rain until Thursday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Labour party MPs suspended after voting against two-child benefit cap
item.description: Seven Labour MPs, including John McDonnell, have been suspended for six months after voting against the government on an amendment to scrap the two-child benefit cap. The cap, which prevents parents from claiming Universal Credit or child tax credit for more than two children, remains a contentious issue, with suspended MPs advocating for its removal to alleviate child poverty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea does ‘not care’ About Trump’s words for Kim
item.description: North Korea’s state media dismissed former President Donald Trump's claims of having good ties with leader Kim Jong Un, stating “we do not care” and emphasizing that its nuclear arsenal is prepared for any US leader. The Korean Central News Agency commented that while Trump attempted to foster personal relations, North Korea viewed US policy as consistently hostile.

item.title: Australian woman gang raped in Paris ahead of 2024 Olympics
item.description: ​​The 25-year-old woman sought shelter in a kebab shop located in the Pigalle district on July 20 morning, with her dress partially torn, a CCTV footage shows.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: 'Pissed off' whales topple boat, fishermen into sea in US
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sudan's RSF agrees to US-backed 'cease-fire' talks
item.description: Sudanese RSF leader welcomes upcoming US-backed cease-fire talks aimed at ending the civil war. UN documents grave human rights violations including killings, sexual violence, and use of child soldiers. Conflict has uprooted millions and sparked famine fears.

item.title: Missing 15-year-old teen found safe after showing up on her own
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
